tasks.description: найти текст стихотворения 'Father Son and Holy Ghost' Аудре Лорд

result.query: найти текст стихотворения 'Father Son and Holy Ghost' Аудре Лорд

facts.fact: The poem 'Father Son and Holy Ghost' is by Audre Lorde.
The poem was published in the 'Collected Poems of Audre Lorde' in 1997.
The speaker in the poem reflects on not having seen their father's grave.
The poem includes imagery of the father's 'judgment eyes' and 'great hands' on evening doorknobs.

sources.title: Father Son and Holy Ghost | The Poetry Foundation
sources.snippet:
Source: Collected Poems of Audre Lorde (W. W. Norton and Company Inc., 1997) [...] pulls up the grass his stillness grows

calling it weed.

Each week    a different woman

has my mother’s face

and he

who time has    changeless

must be amazed

who knew and loved

but one.

My father died in silence

loving creation

and well-defined response

he lived    still judgments

on familiar things

and died    knowing

a January 15th that year me.

Lest I go into dust

I have not ever seen my father’s grave.

Copyright Credit: Audre Lorde, “Father Son and Holy Ghost” from Collected Poems of Audre L

sources.snippet:
# NC Poetry Out Loud 2009 -"Father Son and the Holy Ghost" by Audre Lorde
## NCArts
2380 subscribers
9 likes

### Description
1922 views
Posted: 28 Apr 2009
Symone Stukes, of Independence High School, recites "Father Son and the Holy Ghost" by Audre Lorde. 

Symone was one of 28 students that were semi-finalists and finalists in the statewide Poetry Out Loud competition at the Museum of History in Raleigh in a program coordinated by the NC Arts Council.

Sponsored by the National Endowment for the Arts and the Poetry Foundation, Poetry Out Loud encourages high school students to memorize a

### Audre Lorde

## Father Son and Holy Ghost

I have not ever seen my father’s grave.

Not that his judgment eyes

have been forgotten

nor his great hands’ print

on our evening doorknobs

one half turn each night

and he would come

drabbled with the world’s business

massive and silent

as the whole day’s wish

ready to redefine

each of our shapes

but now the evening doorkno
